actions.text: House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs Discharged by Suspension of Rules.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Considered by House Unfinished Business.  Vote Postponed Until Oct 18, 83.
Passed House by Yea-Nay Vote: 410 - 0 (Record Vote No: 388).
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.
Committee on Banking. Approved for reporting without amendment favorably.
Committee on Banking. Reported to Senate by Senator Garn without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 525.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

official_title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to coin and sell a national medal in honor of the members and former members of the Armed Forces of the United States who served in the Vietnam conflict.

summary.text: Vietnam Veterans National Medal Act - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to coin and sell a medal in honor of the members and former members of the Armed Forces who served in Vietnam. Declares that the Secretary shall offer such medals for sale to the public at a price sufficient to cover the cost of minting and distributing of such medals.

titles.title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to coin and sell a national medal in honor of the members and former members of the Armed Forces of the United States who served in the Vietnam conflict.
